•She can't keep her nose out of other people's business.她总是喜欢多管闲事。

UK [nəʊz] US [noʊz] noun countable keep / put your nose to the grindstone informal ■to work very hard for a long time 长时间苦干
•She kept her nose to the grindstone all year and got the exam results she wanted.她整整一年勤奋苦学，终于取得了满意的考试成绩。

UK [nəʊz] US [noʊz] noun countable nose in the air ■describes the way someone behaves when they think they are better than other people and do not want to speak to them 鼻孔朝天，目中无人
•She walked past me with her nose in the air.她旁若无人地从我身边走过。

UK [nəʊz] US [noʊz] noun countable nose to tail ■one closely behind the other 首尾相接
•The cars were parked nose to tail down the street.汽车一辆紧接着一辆地停在街道上。

UK [nəʊz] US [noʊz] noun countable on the nose ■exactly right, often an exact amount of money or time （常指钱或时间）准确无误
•Her description of the play was really on the nose.她对这部戏的描述真是分毫不差。

UK [nəʊz] US [noʊz] noun countable poke/stick your nose into sth informal ■to try to discover things which are not really related to you 探听，探问（不相干的事）
•I wish he'd stop poking his nose into my personal life!我希望他别再探听我的私生活！

UK [nəʊz] US [noʊz] noun countable put sb's nose out of joint informal ■to offend or upset someone, especially by getting something that they were wanting for themselves （尤指因夺人所爱而）冒犯，激怒（某人）
•John's nose was really put out of joint when Jane was promoted and he wasn't.简得到提升而约翰却没有，他为此鼻子都气歪了。

UK [nəʊz] US [noʊz] noun countable (from) under your nose (US also (out from) under your nose) ■used about something bad which happens in an obvious way but in a way that you do not notice or cannot prevent 在…眼皮底下发生（指坏事就在眼前发生但却没有注意到或无法阻止）
•She stole the shoes from right under the assistant's nose.她在售货员的眼皮底下把鞋偷走了。

UK [nəʊz] US [noʊz] verb SEARCH  寻找  intransitive usually + adverb or preposition informal ■to look around or search in order to discover something, especially something that other people do not want you to find 窥探，打探（尤指他人不欲公开的事）；搜寻
•There were some journalists nosing about/around.有些记者在四处打探新闻。

•The police came in and started nosing into drawers and looking through papers.警方到来后开始搜查抽屉，翻检文件。

UK [nəʊz] US [noʊz] verb VEHICLE  交通工具  intransitive or transitive [+ adv/prep] ■to (make a vehicle) move forwards slowly and carefully 小心翼翼地行驶
•The car nosed out of the side street, its driver peering anxiously around.司机一边紧张地四下张望，一边小心翼翼地把车驶出小路。

•He carefully nosed his lorry into the small gap.他小心翼翼地把大卡车开进这个狭窄的空间。-

UK [nəʊz] US [noʊz] verb   Phrasal Verbs   [M] nose sth out informal ■to discover something by searching carefully 侦察出；打探出；查出
•He soon nosed out the details of the accident by chatting innocently to people and making some phone calls.和人们随意闲聊，并打了几通电话之后，他很快就摸清了事故的细节。




n. 鼻子；嗅觉；突出的部分；探问
 - smell, boko
vt. 嗅；用鼻子触
 - smell, snuff at
vi. 小心探索着前进；探问
 - ask after
examples: 英 [nəʊz] 美 [noʊz]
n.鼻子；突出部分；嗅觉v.嗅到；探听

(1) He quirked up his nose to make a face.(2) I wrinkled up my nose at the nasty smell.(3) The child pressed her nose against the window.(4) Insert the nose of the staple remover firmly under the staple.(5) He has a good nose for a secret.(6) His nose told him that he was getting near the cow shed.(7) The dog nosed out a rat.(8) If there is anything wrong with the car, he can nose it out.(9) I'll go and nose about for more news.(10) Don't nose into other people's affairs.(11) That man will nose out a scandal anywhere.
(1) 他鼻子一扬作了个鬼脸。(2) 我闻到那股难闻的味，皱起了鼻子。(3) 那小女孩把鼻子贴在窗户上。(4) 将起钉机的尖端牢固地插在缝合钉的下面。(5) 他对秘密有好的嗅觉。(6) 他的嗅觉告诉他, 他正走近牛棚。(7) 那只狗闻到了老鼠的气味。(8) 要是汽车出了什么毛病，他就能觉察出来。(9) 我们去打听一下更多的消息。(10) 别干涉他人的事。(11) 那个人在什么地方都会探听出丑闻。

translation:
n. 笔记; 便笺; 音符; 钞票
vt. 注意; 记录; 对…加注释; 指出

时态：noted, noting, notes
分布：注意(82%)，记录(7%)，笔记(2%)，注解(2%)，纸币(2%)，便条(2%)，音符(1%)，音调(1%)，票据(1%)


→来自拉丁语nota,记号，标记，记录，可能来自gno,去知道，了解，词源同notice,know.
n.笔记;按语,注释;钞票,纸币v.记下,摘下Can you change a $5 note?你能找得开一张五元票子吗?



US [noʊt] noun WRITING  写的东西   ESSENTIAL  countable ■a short piece of writing 短笺，便条
•He left a note to say he would be home late.他留下字条说他会晚点回家。

•There's a note pinned to the door saying when the shop will open again.门上钉着一张便条，上面写着商店何时重新开张。
 IMPROVER  countable ■a short explanation or an extra piece of information that is given at the bottom of a page, at the back of a book or on the cover for a piece of recorded music, etc 注释，说明；批注；（音乐作品的）封套介绍
•For a further explanation see Note 3.详细解释参见注释3。
⇒ See also footnotenotes [plural]  IMPROVER  ■information written on paper 记录，笔记
•The wind blew my notes all over the room.风把我的笔记吹得满屋都是。

•The journalist took notes throughout the interview.采访过程中记者一直在做笔记。

UK [nəʊt] US [noʊt] noun SOUND  声音   ADVANCED  countable ■a single sound at a particular level, usually in music, or a written symbol which represents this sound 音；音符
•high/low notes高／低音

•She played three long notes on the piano.她在钢琴上弹了三个长音。

•The engine noise suddenly changed its note and rose to a whine.引擎噪音突然越来越响，变成了尖叫声。

UK [nəʊt] US [noʊt] noun WAY OF EXPRESSING  语调  only singular ■an emotion or a way of expressing something 语调；口吻
•There was a  note  of caution in her letter.她的信中带着一丝谨慎。

•His speech struck just the right note.他发言的语调恰如其分。

•The meeting ended on an optimistic note.这次会议在一片乐观的气氛中结束。

UK [nəʊt] US [noʊt] noun MONEY  金钱  countable mainly UK (US usually bill) ■a piece of paper money 纸币
•a £20 note20英镑的纸币

•He took a wad of notes from his pocket.他从口袋中拿出一叠钞票。

UK [nəʊt] US [noʊt] noun IMPORTANCE  重要性  uncountable formal ■importance, or when something deserves attention 重要性；值得注意之处
•There was nothing of note in the latest report.最近的这份报告中并无值得关注之处。

UK [nəʊt] US [noʊt] noun make/take a note  IMPROVER  ■to write something down or remember it carefully 记录；记住，记下
•I'll just take a note of your name and address.我只记一下你的姓名和地址。

•She made a mental note of the title.她牢牢地记住了标题。

•Make a note to phone again next week.一定记得下周再打电话。

UK [nəʊt] US [noʊt] noun take note of sth ■to give attention to something, especially because it is important 关注，留意（尤指重要之事）
•You should take careful note of what she tells you because she knows their strategy well.你应该仔细留意她对你说的话，因为她对他们的策略了如指掌。

UK [nəʊt] US [noʊt] verb transitive slightly formal  ADVANCED  ■to notice something 留意，注意
•They noted the consumers' growing demand for quicker service.他们留意到消费者对便捷服务与日俱增的需求。

•[+ (that)] Please note (that) we will be closed on Saturday.请注意我们周六不营业。

•[+ question word] Note how easy it is to release the catch quickly.注意看，迅速拉开插销有多么容易。
 ADVANCED  ■to give your attention to something by discussing it or making a written record of it 谈到；论及
•[+ that] He said the weather was beyond our control, noting that last summer was one of the hottest on record.他说天气超出了我们的掌控范围，并提到去年夏天是有史以来最炎热的一个夏天。

•In the article, she notes several cases of medical incompetence.在文章中，她提到了几宗医疗事故的案例。

UK [nəʊt] US [noʊt] verb transitive slightly formal   Phrasal Verbs   note sth down ■to write something so that you do not forget it 把…记下来
•I noted down his phone number.我记下了他的电话号码。





message, correspondence, letter, note

这组词都有“信”的意思，其区别是：
message: 指书信、口信、电报等。
correspondence: 集合名词，指全部来往信件。
letter: 最普通用词，泛指一切形式的书信，尤指邮寄的信。
note: 指内容直截了当的短信或便条，正式或非正式均可。



attend, remark, mind, notice, note

这组词都有“注意”的意思，其区别是：
attend: 一般用词，侧重专心于某事。
remark: 一般指经过思维活动而注意到。
mind: 指用心地去观察，了解某人或某物以达到某一目的。常用于命令句中。
notice: 指对所见所闻所感的人或事作出的反应，侧重结果。
note: 语气比notice强，指不仅注意到，而且记录下来，侧重注意的认真与仔细。


n. 笔记； [声] 音符； [金融] 票据；注解；纸币；便笺；照会；调子
 - bill, minute, William
vt. 注意；记录；注解
 - watching, register, take care of
examples: 英 [nəʊt] 美 [noʊt]
n.笔记；便条；纸币；音符；票据；注解；音调vt.注意；记录；注解

(1) Students should take notes during the lectures.(2) Seeing nobody at home, he decided to leave a note.(3) I'd like to break this 50 dollars note.(4) You should pay off the note before our next cooperation.(5) Pay attention to the notes on each page;those notes might be the focus of our exam.(6) There was a note of warning in what he said.(7) I failed to note that he had left.(8) Let me note down your address and telephone number.(9) The meaning of this sentence is noted on the lower right part of the page.
(1) 学生们上课应该做笔记。(2) 看到没人在家,他决定留下一个便条。(3) 我想把这张50美元的纸币换开。(4) 在我们下次合作之前,你应该把票据付清。(5) 注意课文每页的注释,它们可能是我们考试的重点。(6) 他的话带有一种警告的口气。(7) 我没有注意到他已经走了。(8) 让我记下你的地址和电话号码。(9) 这句话的意思在书页的右下方有注解。
[sound:youdao-c9e9274d-77f51b5a-8c696f9c-77e1ff2e-597a517e.mp3]

translation:
n. 注意; 布告; 警告; 预告
vt. & vi. 注意
vt. 通知; 留心; 关照; 注意到
vi. 引起注意

时态：noticed, noticing, notices
分布：注意(86%)，通知(9%)，布告(3%)，留心(2%)


→来自拉丁语notus,知道的，了解的，来自gno,去知道，了解，词源同know,narrate.引申词义注意。
注意;通知(not+ice)[Not=know,表示"知道,注意"]
n.通知,通告,布告;注意,认识v.注意到,注意In the hot hotel the devoted voter did not notice the noticeable notebook.在炎热的旅馆里,热心的投票者没有注意到显而易见的笔记本.



US ['noʊ.tˌɪs] verb  ESSENTIAL  intransitive or transitive ■to see or become conscious of something or someone 看到；注意到；感觉到
•I noticed a crack in the ceiling.我注意到天花板上有一道裂缝。

•Mary waved at the man but he didn't seem to notice.玛丽朝那个男人挥手，但他似乎没有看到。

•[+ (that)] He noticed (that) the woman was staring at him.他察觉到那个女人正盯着他。

•[+ question word] Did you notice how she did that?你注意到她是怎么做的了吗？
transitive often passive ■to bring someone to the attention of the public, usually because of their unusual skill, etc （以出众的才华）引起（公众）关注
•She was first noticed by the critics at the age of 12, and went on to become a world-famous violinist.十二岁时她第一次引起评论家的注意，此后她平步青云，成为了世界知名的小提琴家。

UK ['nəʊ.tɪs] US ['noʊ.tˌɪs] noun INFORMATION  信息   ESSENTIAL  countable ■(a board, piece of paper, etc. containing) information or instructions 告示，布告；启事；公告牌，警示牌
•There was a large notice on the wall saying 'No Parking'.墙上有一张很大的公告牌写著「禁止停车”。

•I saw a notice in the paper announcing their marriage.我看见他们在报纸刊登的结婚启事了。
notices [plural] ■printed statements of opinion in the newspapers about plays, films, books, etc （报纸上关於戏剧、电影、图书等的）评论
•The musical has received wonderful notices.那部音乐剧大受好评。

UK ['nəʊ.tɪs] US ['noʊ.tˌɪs] noun WARNING  警告   IMPROVER  uncountable ■information or a warning given about something that is going to happen in the future 预告；事先通知；事前警告
•The next time you visit, can you give me more notice?你下次来之前能否先通知我？

•The emergency services are ready to spring into action at a moment's notice.紧急应变机构随时准备采取行动。

•The building is closed until further notice (= until another official announcement is made).该建筑将一直关闭，开放时间有待另行通知。
uncountable ■a letter or statement from an employer or from an employee saying that they will leave their job after a particular period of time, or this period of time 辞职信（通知）；解雇信（通知）
•Do I have to work out my notice?我需要写一份辞呈吗？
give sb notice ■to ask someone who works for you to leave their job, usually after a particular period of time （通常指提前）向（某人）发出解雇通知
•My boss gave me a month's notice.老板提前一个月向我发出了解雇通知。
hand/give in your notice ■to tell your employer that you intend to leave your job after a particular period of time （事先）提出离职通知；递交辞呈
•I handed in my notice yesterday.我昨天递交了辞呈。

UK ['nəʊ.tɪs] US ['noʊ.tˌɪs] noun ATTENTION  注意  uncountable ■attention 注意；关注
•It has come to/been brought to my notice (= I have been told) that you have been late for work every day this week.有人告诉我，你这周天天上班都迟到。
take notice  IMPROVER  ■to give attention to something 注意，在意
•I asked him to drive more slowly, but he didn't take any notice.我要他慢点开车，但他根本不在意。

•Don't take any notice of/Take no notice of what your mother says - she's just in a bad mood.别在意你母亲说的话——她只是心情不好。

UK ['nəʊ.tɪs] US ['noʊ.tˌɪs] noun at short notice UK (US on short notice) ■only a short time before something happens 在短时间内；一经通知立即
•I can't cancel my arrangements at such short notice.我无法在这么短的时间内取消我的安排。





catch sight of, observe, notice

catch sight of: 突然看到
observe: 观察,仔细地看, observe the stars
notice: 注意到,



attend, remark, mind, notice, note

这组词都有“注意”的意思，其区别是：
attend: 一般用词，侧重专心于某事。
remark: 一般指经过思维活动而注意到。
mind: 指用心地去观察，了解某人或某物以达到某一目的。常用于命令句中。
notice: 指对所见所闻所感的人或事作出的反应，侧重结果。
note: 语气比notice强，指不仅注意到，而且记录下来，侧重注意的认真与仔细。


n. 通知，布告；注意；公告
 - advice, information, announcement, declaration, regard
vt. 通知；注意到；留心
 - message, observe
vi. 引起注意
 - draw attention, make a dent
examples: 英 ['nəʊtɪs] 美 ['noʊtɪs]
vt.注意；留心；通知n.通知；注意；布告

(1) He walked so fast that he didn't notice his wife.(2) I notice you aren't quite convinced.(3) As soon as your application is approved, I will personally notice you.(4) Information maybe revised without prior notice.(5) Her appearance attracted my notice.(6) Meal times are shown on the notice board.(7) I posted a notice about it on the bulletin board.
(1) 他走得太快了,连他夫人都没注意到。(2) 我感到你还不太相信。(3) 核发登记证时我会通知您。(4) 数据如有修改,恕不另行通知。(5) 她的外表引起了我的注意。(6) 告示牌上写有用餐时间。(7) 我把有关那件事的通告贴在布告栏上。
[sound:youdao-249745b2-f7c6c371-3ef62c7d-fff60db8-ed79905a.mp3]

translation:
adj. 显而易见的，明显的; 引人注目的，令人瞩目的; 显著的，重要的; 可以察觉的

分布：显著的(45%)，显而易见的(35%)，值得注意的(20%)


→来自notice,注意。
a.显而易见的,值得注意的,重要的In the hot hotel the devoted voter did not notice the noticeable notebook.在炎热的旅馆里,热心的投票者没有注意到显而易见的笔记本.



US ['noʊ.tˌɪ-] adjective  ADVANCED  ■easy to see or recognize 显而易见的，明显的，显著的
•There has been a noticeable improvement in Tim's cooking.提姆的烹饪水准显著提高。





striking, remarkable, noticeable, outstanding, conspicuous

这组词都有“显著的，引人注意的”的意思，其区别是：
striking: 侧重能给观察者产生强烈而深刻印象。
remarkable: 通常指因有与众不同的特点或优越性而引起人们注意或称道。
noticeable: 指所描绘的事物引人注意。
outstanding: 通常指与同行或同类的人相比显得优秀或杰出，或具有他人或别的事物所没有的特征。
conspicuous: 通常指因成绩卓著，而引人注意，或指因外观奇特、花哨或言行举止不合常规而令人注意。


adj. 显而易见的，显著的；值得注意的
 - obvious, prominent, remarkable, marked, noted
examples: 英 ['nəʊtɪsəbl] 美 ['noʊtɪsəbl]
adj.显而易见的；显著的；值得注意的

(1) The scar on her forehead is hardly noticeable.(2) There's been a noticeable improvement in her handwriting.(3) His good humour was particularly noticeable.(4) The specialists did not uncover any noticeable deviations from the norm.
(1) 她额头上的伤疤不太明显。(2) 她的书法有了明显的进步。(3) 他的幽默感是显而易见的。(4) 专科医师并未发现任何值得注意的异状。
[sound:youdao-76b58d6c-bbadb323-07ca682d-25fa2346-a3dd144e.mp3]

translation:
n. （长篇）小说; [法]新法，附律
adj. 新奇的; 异常的

分布：小说(96%)，新奇的(4%)


→来自拉丁语novus,新的，词源同new,-el,小词后缀。引申词义新事物，新故事，后特别用于指一种文学体裁，即小故事，小说（长篇小说）。
新奇的n.小说(nov+el)[nov=new,表示"新的"]
小说(nov新奇+el)[-el表名词"人或物"]
n.(长篇)小说a.新奇的,新颖的The novel has been translated into many languages.这部小说已译成多种语言.



US ['nɑ:.vəl] noun countable  IMPROVER  ■a long printed story about imaginary characters and events （长篇）小说
•a paperback novel平装小说

•historical/romantic novels历史／爱情小说

•Have you read any of Jane Austen's novels?你读过简．奥斯汀的小说吗？

•His latest novel is selling really well.他的最新小说非常畅销。

UK ['nɒv.əl] US ['nɑ:.vəl] adjective ■new and original, not like anything seen before 新颖的，新奇的
•a novel idea/suggestion新颖的观点／建议

•Keeping a sheep in the garden is a novel way of keeping the grass short!在花园里养只羊来阻止草长高，这办法可真新奇！





story, tale, fiction, fable, romance, novel

这组词都有“小说，故事”的意思，其区别是：
story: 指篇幅较短，常包含一系列情节或事件，口述或书写成文的故事。
tale: 常可与story换用，指以事实为中心作叙述的故事，也指古代流传下来的传说故事或神话故事。
fiction: 指部分或全部虚构的短篇、中篇、长篇小说，也指传奇故事，是小说的总称。
fable: 指短小而寓有教育意义的虚构故事。故事的主人公多为拟人化的动物或非动物之类。也作传说解。
romance: 系novel早期的代用词，泛指具有强烈神话和传奇色彩的故事，现指爱情故事。
novel: 指任何有情节、人物、对白，虚构的长篇散文体故事。



new, fresh, original, innovative, novel

这组词都有“新的”的意思，其区别是：
new: 普通用词，与old相对，指最近的或创新的。
fresh: 指新鲜的、新做的，侧重创新。
original: 强调独创性。
innovative: 强调富有创新和革新精神。
novel: 侧重新事物的新奇和独特。


adj. 新奇的；异常的
 - patent, exquisite
n. 小说
 - story, fiction
examples: 英 ['nɒvl] 美 ['nɑːvl]
n.小说adj.新奇的
(1) The novel is considered a brilliant performance.(2) I like reading novels in my spare time.(3) This film is based on a novel by D.H.Lawrence.(4) It's a novel idea.(5) It's a novel experience.
(1) 这部小说被认为是出色的佳作。(2) 我喜欢闲暇时读小说。(3) 这部影片是根据D.(4) 那是个异常的想法。(5) 那是一段新奇的经历。
[sound:youdao-623a972f-4f7d1827-e5755342-97726b1c-6f0cedab.mp3]

translation:
n. 十一月

→来自拉丁语November mensis,九月，来自novem,九，词源同nine.原指古罗马历的九月，后由于历法改革，增加了January和February，原先的九月顺延至十一月。比较December.
n.十一月He was shot on November 19, 1915.他在1915年11月19日被枪杀.



US [noʊ'vem.bɚ] (written abbreviation Nov) noun countable or uncountable  ESSENTIAL  ■the eleventh month of the year, after October and before December 十一月

•Guy Fawkes' Night is on the fifth of November/November the fifth/ mainly USNovember fifth.盖伊．福克斯之夜是在11月5日。

•The factory opened last November.这家工厂于去年11月投入生产。

•He's starting his new job in November.他将于11月开始新工作。
examples: 英 [nəʊ'vembə(r)] 美 [noʊ'vembər]
n.十一月
(1) November is the high tourist season for southeast Asia.
(1) 十一月是东南亚旅游的旺季。

translation:
adv. 现在; 其时; 立刻; （改变话题或要对方做某事前，引起对方注意）喂
adj. 现在的; 当今的; 现任的
n. 现在; 目前; 目前
conj. 由于; 既然

分布：现在(94%)，此刻(3%)，立刻(1%)，目前的(1%)，现存的(1%)


→来自古英语nu,现在，可能原义为新的，词源同new.
ad.现在,如今,目前;当时,于是,然后I used to abuse the unusual usage, but now I'm not used to doing so.我过去常滥用这个不寻常的用法,但我现在不习惯这样做.



adverb AT PRESENT  现在   ESSENTIAL  ■at the present time, not in the past or future 现在，此刻，目前
•She used to be a teacher, but now she works in publishing.她过去曾是一名教师，但现在从事出版工作。

•I may eat something later, but I'm not hungry now.我过一会儿可能会想吃点儿东西，但现在不饿。

•Many people now own a video recorder.如今许多人都有录影机。
 ESSENTIAL  ■immediately 马上，立刻
•I don't want to wait until tomorrow, I want it now!我不想等到明天，我现在就要！
 ESSENTIAL  ■used to express how long something has been happening, from when it began to the present time 至今
•She's been a vegetarian for ten years now.她吃素已经十年了。
■used in stories or reports of past events to describe a new situation or event （用于描述过去的新情况或新事件）此刻，这时候
•It was getting dark now and we were tired.这时候天越来越黑，我们疲惫不堪。
■used when describing a situation that is the result of what someone just said or did （用于描述刚刚所说或所做之事的结果）这样一来
•Oh yes, now I know who you mean.哦，是的，这样一来我就知道你指的是谁了。
any minute/moment/second/time now  ADVANCED  ■very soon 很快，不久
•Our guests will be arriving any moment now and the house is still a mess.我们的客人马上就要到了，可家里还是乱糟糟的。
now for... informal ■used to introduce a new subject （用于引出新话题）接着要谈
•And now for what we're going to do tomorrow.现在我们来讨论一下明天要做甚么。

[naʊ] adverb IN SPEECH  在话语中  ■used in statements and questions to introduce or give emphasis to what you are saying （用于陈述句和疑问句，引导后面的话或对其加以强调）
•Now, where did I put my hat?唉，我把我的帽子放哪里了？

•There was a knock at the door. Now Jan knew her mother had promised to visit, so she assumed it was her.有人敲门。简知道妈妈答应过要来，所以认为敲门的是她。

•Hurry, now, or you'll miss the bus!快点，否则你就赶不上公车了！

•Sorry, I can't today. Now if you'd asked me yesterday, I would have said yes.抱歉，我今天不行。如果你昨天问我的话，我会说行的。

[naʊ] adverb It's now or never. saying ■said when you must do something immediately, especially because you will not get another chance 机不可失；勿失良机
[naʊ] adverb (every) now and then/again ■sometimes, but not very often 有时，偶尔
•We meet up for lunch now and then, but not as often as we used to.我们偶尔聚在一起吃个午饭，但不如过去那么频繁了。

[naʊ] adverb now then ■said to attract attention to what you are going to ask or suggest （引起注意）喂，听着
•Now then, what's all this fuss about?喂，这样大惊小怪的是为甚么呢？

[naʊ] adverb Now you're talking. saying ■said when someone makes a suggestion or offer that is better than one that they have already made 这下你说对了；这个建议可真是不错
[naʊ] adverb now, now ■said when you want to make someone feel better or give them a gentle warning （用于安慰）好了，好了；（用于委婉的警告）行了，行了
•Now, now, don't cry.好了，好了，别哭了。

•Now, now, children, stop fighting!行了，孩子们，别打了！

[naʊ] noun uncountable  ESSENTIAL  ■the present moment or time 现在，此刻
•Now isn't a good time to speak to him.现在不适合跟他谈话。

•I thought you'd have finished by now.我以为你现在该完成了。

•You should have mentioned it before now.你本该之前就提到它。

•That's all for now (= until a future point in time).暂时就这样吧。
from now on/as from now ■from this moment and always in the future 从现在开始
•From now on the gates will be locked at midnight.从现在开始，大门会在午夜上锁。

[naʊ] conjunction now (that)...  IMPROVER  ■used to give an explanation of a new situation 既然，由于
•Now I've got a car, I don't get as much exercise as I used to.有车之后，我的活动量不如从前大了。

•She's enjoying the job now that she's got more responsibility.因为承担了更多的职责，所以她很喜欢这份工作。




adv. 现在；如今；立刻
 - soon, immediately, shortly
adj. 现在的
 - current, present, nowaday
n. 现在；目前
 - present, these days
conj. 由于；既然
 - since, when, seeing
examples: 英 [naʊ] 美 [naʊ]
adv.现在；立刻conj.既然(与that连用)n.现在；此刻adj.目前的；现存的abbr.全国妇女组织(=National Organization of Women)

(1) It is now possible to put a man on the moon.(2) He is writing a letter now.(3) Now you see I am telling you the truth.(4) You can click here to download the file now.(5) Gas is now widely used for cooking and heating.(6) The mystery has now come to light.(7) The boss is being in royal spirits right now.(8) Now he slept quietly with his fathers.(9) Now all are participating in this.(10) She had now a life filled also with a beneficent activity.(11) Now, a living language has been found that can play the same intermediary role more successfully.(12) The tools now exist to draw together related material from different domains in a network environment.

(1) 目前已能将人送到月球上。(2) 他现在正在写信。(3) 现在你明白我对你讲的是真话了。(4) 你可以点击这里立刻下载文件。(5) 现在普遍用煤气烧饭和取暖。(6) 这个秘密现在已被揭开了。(7) 此刻，老板情绪极好。(8) 此刻他安静地躺在祖坟中。(9) 目前的事大家都插手了。(10) 她目前的生活里善行颇多。(11) 最近，已找到了一种现存的语言，它能更有效地起到中间媒介的作用。(12) 现存的工具是在网络的环境下从不同的领域同时描绘相关的材料。
[sound:youdao-1f107f60-709c64a2-f03d76a4-94b8658b-e9eef6cf.mp3]

translation:

n. 当今，现在

分布：现今(54%)，现在(46%)


→即现在的日子，现今。
ad.现今,现在Nowadays people travel by plane.如今人们乘飞机旅行.



adverb  ADVANCED  ■at the present time, in comparison to the past 如今，现在
•Who remembers those films nowadays?如今谁还记得那些电影？

•Nowadays, I bake my own bread rather than buy it.现在，我自己烤面包而不去买现成的了。

['naʊ.ə.deɪz] adverb   Common Learner Errors   nowadaysWarning: Check your spelling!Nowadays is one of the 50 words most often spelled wrongly by learners.Remember: the correct spelling has 'a' between 'now' and 'days'.



adv. 现今；时下
 - today, contemporarily

(1) Nowadays we rely increasingly on computers for help/to help us.(2) Nowadays people travel in cars rather than carriages.(3) Portable telephones are very popular nowadays.(4) Nowadays, children often prefer watching TV to reading.(5) Nowadays, the poor student has become a rich man.(6) Lasers can be used to perform operations nowadays.(7) Phonograph is no longer used nowadays.(8) It is rare to find such a genius nowadays.(9) Nowadays many people die of cancer.
(1) 现今人们越来越依赖计算机协助工作。(2) 现今人们旅行都坐汽车，而不使用马车。(3) 现今，移动电话非常普及。(4) 如今，儿童常爱看电视而不爱看书。(5) 如今，那个穷学生成了富人。(6) 现在激光可以用来做手术。(7) 留声机现在已不再使用了。(8) 这样的天才现在很少见。(9) 现在有很多人死于癌症。

ad.任何地方都不,没有地方Wherever I go, nowhere I like; I dislike everywhere.无论我到哪里,没有哪里为我喜欢,我讨厌每一个地方.



US ['noʊ.wer] adverb  ESSENTIAL  ■in, at or to no place; not anywhere 任何地方都不；无处

UK ['nəʊ.weər] US ['noʊ.wer] adverb from/out of nowhere ■very suddenly and unexpectedly 突然；出人意料地

→来自拉丁语nux, 果仁，核，词源同nut,nucleus,-ar,形容词后缀。引申词义原子核的，细胞核的。
a.核心的,中心的;原子核的,核能的With my own ears I clearly heard the heart beat of the nuclear bomb.我亲耳清楚地听到原子弹的心脏的跳动.



US ['nu:.kli:.ɚ] adjective POWER  能源   ESSENTIAL  ■being or using the power produced when the nucleus of an atom is divided or joined to another nucleus 核能的；使用核能的
•nuclear energy/power核能／核动力

•a nuclear power plant核电站

•the nuclear industry核工业

•a nuclear war/attack核战争／核打击

•nuclear disarmament核裁军

•How many nations have a nuclear capability (= have nuclear weapons) ?有多少国家拥有核武器？

UK ['nju:.klɪər] US ['nu:.kli:.ɚ] adjective PHYSICS  物理学  specialized■relating to the nucleus of an atom 原子核的

→来自拉丁语nux,果仁，核，词源同nut.引申词义原子核，细胞核。
n.(pl.nuclei)核,核心,原子核These books are regarded as the nucleus of the library.这1000本书被看作是图书馆的核心部分.



US ['nu:-] (plural nuclei or nucleuses)noun countable specialized ■the central part of an atom, usually made up of protons and neutrons 原子核■specialized■the part of a cell that controls its growth 细胞核

the nucleus of sth ■the group of people or things which are the most important part of something …的核心

translation:
n. 数字; 数量; 号码; 编号
v. 标号; 总计; 把…算作

时态：numbered, numbering, numbs
分布：号码(33%)，数量(24%)，数字(22%)，编号(17%)，总计(3%)，把 ... 算作(1%)


→来自拉丁语numerus,数字，数量，插入字母b,来自nem,分配，分开，词源同numeracy,nemesis.引申词义分开的数量，数字。
n.数,数字,数量,号码,一群v.共计,编号There was a decrease in the number of children in school.在校的儿童人数有所减少.



US [-bɚ] noun SYMBOL  符号   ESSENTIAL  countable ■(a sign or symbol representing) a unit which forms part of the system of counting and calculating 数字
•25, 300 and a billion are all numbers.25 300和10亿都是数字。

•She's very good with numbers (= good at adding, subtracting, etc).她非常擅长数字运算。
 ESSENTIAL  countable (written abbreviation no.) ■one of a series of the symbols used in counting, which is used to mark a particular example of something 号码；…号
•They live at number 34 Orchard Street.他们住在果园街34号。

•Please write your credit card number on this form.请把你的信用卡号写在这张表格上。

•What's our flight number?我们的航班号码是多少？
 ESSENTIAL  countable (written abbreviation no.) ■a telephone number 电话号码
•I gave him my number.我把自己的电话号码给了他。
  Common Learner Errors   number or figure?To talk about a set of numbers or an amount expressed in numbers, the more usual word is figures.Don't say 'unemployment/sales/tax numbers', say unemployment/sales/tax figures :✗ Our sales numbers were better this year than last year.Our sales figures were better this year than last year.
UK ['nʌm.bər] US [-bɚ] noun AMOUNT  数量   ESSENTIAL  only singular [+ sing/pl verb] ■an amount or total 数目；总数
•The number of people killed in road accidents fell last month.上个月，死于交通事故的人数有所下降。

•There has been an increasing number of cases of the disease.患这种病的人数持续上升。

•A small number of children are educated at home.少数孩子在家接受教育。

•slightly formal A large number of invitations has been sent.已经发出大量请柬。

•Letters of complaint were surprisingly few in number (= there were not many of them).投诉信出乎意料的少。
numbers [plural] ■a number of a particular description 数量
•Small numbers of children are educated at home.少数孩子在家接受教育。

•Large numbers of invitations were sent.已经发出大量请柬。

•Newspapers are produced in vast numbers.报纸发行量巨大。
a number of things ■several of a particular type of thing 几个，若干
•I decided not to go, for a number of reasons.我决定不去，有几个理由。
only singular [+ sing/pl verb] ■a group of people 一群人
•On the trip, one of our number fell ill.旅行期间，我们当中有个人病倒了。

UK ['nʌm.bər] US [-bɚ] noun PARTICULAR THING  某个事物  countable ■a particular example of something （特定的）一个countable ■a particular copy of a magazine （杂志的）期，号
•Have you got last week's number of the New Yorker?你有上周那期《纽约客》杂志吗？

•He's got all the back numbers (= previous copies) of the magazine.他保存了这本杂志过去的所有刊本。
countable informal ■a piece of clothing, especially a dress, that you admire （令人欣赏的）衣服，（尤指）连衣裙
•She was wearing a stylish Dior number.她身穿一条时尚的迪奥长裙。
countable US slang ■a person with a particular characteristic 具有…特征的人
•He's a real sexy number, don't you think?他真性感，你不觉得吗？
countable ■a short tune or song 短曲；短歌
•Sing one of those romantic numbers.唱一支那种情歌吧。
countable usually singular mainly US slang ■something that is often said 常说的事
•He tried the usual/that old number about how his wife didn't understand him.他又重施故技，诉说妻子如何不理解他。

UK ['nʌm.bər] US [-bɚ] noun any number of things ■a lot of a particular thing 许多，大量
•His shop stocks any number of different kinds of pasta.他的商店大量出售各种义大利面食。

UK ['nʌm.bər] US [-bɚ] noun beyond/without number literary ■too many to count 多不胜数，不计其数
•An earthquake in the city could result in deaths beyond number.城市发生地震可能导致无数人死亡。

UK ['nʌm.bər] US [-bɚ] noun by (sheer) force / weight of numbers ■because the number of people or things was so great （纯粹）凭借数量上的优势
•The crowd managed to force its way in by sheer weight of numbers.这群人依靠人多势众，强行挤了进来。

UK ['nʌm.bər] US [-bɚ] noun by numbers UK (US by the numbers) ■done according to a plan that has been decided previously, without using your own imagination and ideas 机械地，死板地，按部就班地
•This is painting by numbers - there's nothing original here.这是一幅很死板的画——毫无新意。

UK ['nʌm.bər] US [-bɚ] noun do a number on sb US slang ■to hurt, defeat or embarrass someone 伤害某人；打败某人；使某人难堪
•She really did a number on her old boyfriend, making him beg her to come back and then turning him down.她令以前的男朋友乞求自己回心转意，而后却又拒绝他，这样做严重伤害了他的自尊心。

UK ['nʌm.bər] US [-bɚ] noun have sb's number slang ■to know a lot about someone and so have an advantage over them 对（某人）心中有数；摸透（某人）的底
•Don't worry, I've got his number, he doesn't fool me.别担心，我把他的底细摸得一清二楚，他骗不了我的。

UK ['nʌm.bər] US [-bɚ] noun your number is up slang ■When your number is up, you are going to die （某人）气数已尽，死到临头
•When the plane started to shake, I just thought my number was up.飞机开始摇晃时，我真的以为我要完蛋了。

UK ['nʌm.bər] US [-bɚ] noun a numbers game ■the use of numbers to represent facts in an argument, especially when it makes people believe things that are not true 数字游戏（在论证中运用数字来反映事实，尤用于混淆视听，欺瞒别人）
•It's just a numbers game and everyone does it. You manipulate the statistics till they fit your argument.暗中调整数据，使其能支持自己的论点，这只不过是大家都玩的数字游戏。

UK ['nʌm.bər] US [-bɚ] verb WRITE SYMBOL  写作符号  transitive ■to give something a number in a series and usually to write this number on it 给…编号；给…标号码
•All the folders have been carefully numbered and filed away.所有档夹都被精心编号存档。

•Number the pages from one to ten.从一到十标上页码。

UK ['nʌm.bər] US [-bɚ] verb AMOUNT  数量  [L only + noun] ■If people or things number a particular amount, there are this many of them （数量）多达，共计有
•After the hurricane the homeless numbered over 200 000.飓风过后，总数超过20万人无家可归。

UK ['nʌm.bər] US [-bɚ] verb   Phrasal Verbs   number sb/sth among sb/sth formal ■If you are numbered among a particular group, you belong to that group 把…归入
•At one time, the club numbered an archbishop among its members.该俱乐部曾一度把大主教吸纳为其成员。





amount, sum, number, quantity

这组词都有“总数、总量”的意思，其区别是：
amount: 普通用词，与quantity近义，但强调整体，指把所有数量、重量及度量归并在一起得出的总数。
sum: 普通用词，指简单加算的结果。
number: 普通用词，指人或物的数目，强调数的概念。
quantity: 书面用词，指事物的总量和总数量，侧重大批计量，含准确测量的意味。



figure, number

figure: 指“数字”，着重数字符号
number: 泛指“数”；


n. [数] 数；（杂志等的）期；号码；数字；算术
 - figure, arithmetic, digital
vt. 编号；计入；数…的数目；使为数有限
 - control No., code name
examples: 英 ['nʌmbə(r)] 美 ['nʌmbə(r)]
n.号码；数量；数字v.总计；编号；编号；把 ... 算作

(1) He picked a winning number on the first draw.(2) I slipped up and gave you the wrong phone number.(3) The number of fish in coastal waters has decreased.(4) The number of your finger is ten.(5) He painted the number out on the door.(6) The students of our department numbered in the hundreds.(7) That record numbers among the top ten.(8) That record numbers among the top ten.(9) I am proud to number him among my friends.
(1) 他第一次便抽到一个中奖号码。(2) 我粗心大意给错了你电话号码。(3) 沿海鱼的数量已减少了。(4) 你双手手指的总数是10。(5) 她用漆涂掉了门上的数字。(6) 我们系的学生总共有几百人。(7) 那张唱片列入前十名之中。(8) 那张唱片列入前十名之中。(9) 把他算作我的朋友，我感到自豪。
[sound:youdao-0d6fd783-82be5ec4-def93146-e0d93032-ec8ebaad.mp3]

translation:
adj. 很多的，许多的; 数量庞大的数量庞大的; 数不清的

分布：许多(97%)，为数众多的(3%)


→来自拉丁语numerus,数字，数量。比较numberless.
数目众多的(numer+ous)[numer=number,表示"数目"]
a.众多的,许多的,大批的The room is lumbered with numerous cucumbers.房间里乱堆着大量黄瓜.



US ['nu:-] adjective  IMPROVER  ■many 许多的，大量的
•We have discussed these plans on numerous occasions.我们已经多次讨论过这些计划。

•Shops of this type, once rare, are now numerous (= there are many of them).这种商店从前很少见，但现在已经遍地开花。




adj. 许多的，很多的
 - many, multiple, hundred, plenty
examples: 英 ['njuːmərəs] 美 ['nuːmərəs]
adj.为数众多的；许多

(1) The Earth is only one of the numerous planets in the universe.(2) Those birds have become more numerous lately.(3) Numerous interruptions have prevented me from finishing my work.(4) He appeared, surrounded by his numerous progeny.(5) The Oxford has received numerous endowments.(6) I have numerous engagements for next year.
(1) 地球只是宇宙中众多星球中的一个。(2) 近来那种鸟变得越来越多了。(3) 我屡遭搅扰以致工作未能完成。(4) 他出现时，子女前呼后拥不计其数。(5) 牛津获得了许多捐款。(6) 我明年有许多约会。
[sound:youdao-9d6616ef-7171a09d-853ea6af-71ddefeb-b4e5b347.mp3]

translation:
n. 护士，看护; 奶妈，保姆，阿妈，保育员; 保护人，培养者，养成所，发祥地; [植]保护树，[虫]保护虫，保育虫，[动]世代交替的无性期的个体
vt. & vi. 护理; 照料; 喂; 吃奶
vt. 培育; 怀抱; 搂抱; 调治

时态：nursed, nursing, nurses
分布：护士(81%)，护理(9%)，保姆(6%)，看护(3%)，栽培(1%)


→来自古法语nurrice,养母，奶妈，来自拉丁语nutrire,滋养，喂奶，词源同nourish,nutriment.
n.护士,保姆v.护理,看护In church the nurse cursed the people pursuing the purple purse.在教堂里,护士诅咒了追求紫色钱包的人们.



US [nɝ:s] noun countable  ESSENTIAL  ■(the title given to) a person whose job is to care for people who are ill or injured, especially in a hospital （尤指医院的）护士，护理人员
•He worked as a nurse in a psychiatric hospital.他在精神病院当护士。

•Nurse Millard will be with you shortly.米勒德护士很快会来照顾你。

•[as form of address] Thank you, Nurse.谢谢你，护士。
■old-fashioned ■a woman employed to take care of a young child or children 保姆
UK [nɜ:s] US [nɝ:s] verb transitive TAKE CARE OF  照顾  ■to care for a person or an animal while they are ill 照顾，照料（患病的人或动物）
•He gave up his job so that he could nurse his mother at home.他辞去了工作，这样可以在家专心照顾母亲。

•They found an injured cat and carefully nursed it back to health (= until it was well again).他们发现一只受伤的猫，于是精心照料直至它恢复健康。
■to spend a lot of time taking care of something as it grows or develops 养护，培育
•These young trees were carefully nursed by the head gardener.这些小树得到了主管园丁的精心培育。

•The project will have to be nursed through its first few months.这个企划案在头几个月里必须投入大量精力。
■If you nurse an illness or injury, you rest until it gets better 调治，调养（伤病）
•Robert's in bed nursing a back injury.罗伯特卧床休息，调养背部的伤处。
■to hold a small child in your arms as a way of making them feel better 搂，抱（幼儿）
•She nursed the crying child on her lap.她把哭泣的孩子抱到大腿上。

UK [nɜ:s] US [nɝ:s] verb transitive FEED  喂养  ■When a woman nurses a baby, she feeds it with milk from her breasts. 给（婴儿）哺乳；给（婴儿）喂奶
UK [nɜ:s] US [nɝ:s] verb transitive FEEL EMOTION  心怀  ■to have a strong feeling or an emotion for a long time 心怀，心存
•She had long nursed a passion for Japanese art.长期以来她一直对日本艺术满怀热情。

UK [nɜ:s] US [nɝ:s] verb transitive HOLD  搂  ■to hold a drink for a long time without drinking it 拿着（饮料）不喝，慢慢喝
•Mark was sitting in the corner nursing an almost empty pint glass.马克坐在一角，手里一直拿着一只几乎空了的品脱酒杯。





cherish, nurse, cultivate, foster, tend

这组词都有“照料、培育”的意思，其区别是：
cherish: 强调抚育或爱抚。
nurse: 通常指对无力自顾的婴儿、病人等进行照料或护理。
cultivate: 具体意义指耕耘、培育植物；抽象意义指培养兴趣或向往的理想事物。
foster: 指对孩子的关心、鼓励、供养及抚养其成长；也指鼓励、促进事物的增长与发展。
tend: 指出于责任心、博爱心而不是私人感情去对人或物进行照顾。


vt. 看护，护理；照顾；培养；给…喂奶
 - cultivate, plant, rear
vi. 照料，护理；喂奶；当保姆
 - fend for, attend on
n. [医] 护士；奶妈，保姆
 - sister, amah
examples: 英 [nɜːs] 美 [nɜːrs]
n.护士；保姆v.看护；护理；栽培

(1) A nurse came to put on a clean dressing for him.(2) The nurse diluted the drug with saline water.(3) The nurse is preparing the child to go to hospital.(4) We'll have to put the baby to nurse.(5) You need a housekeeper to nurse your property.(6) This disease is very hard to nurse.(7) He insisted on staying up to nurse the child.
(1) 一位护士来给他包上干净的绷带。(2) 护士用生理盐水把药加以稀释。(3) 保姆正在为孩子住院作准备。(4) 我们只能请人照看婴孩。(5) 你需要雇用一名管家来精心料理你的家产。(6) 这种病很难护理。(7) 他坚持不懈来护理这个小孩。

translation:
n. 婴儿室，幼儿园; 苗圃; 临时托儿所; 温床，滋生地

分布：托儿所(63%)，苗圃(31%)，保育室(6%)


→来自nurse,护理，照料。引申词义幼儿园，苗圃。
托儿所(nurse养育,护理+ery)[-ery 1.表名词"场所,地点"2.表名词"行为,情况"]
n.托儿所The nursery teacher made the children sit bolt upright.幼儿园的老师让孩子们笔直地坐着.



US ['nɝ:.sɚ-] noun countable FOR CHILDREN  为儿童   IMPROVER  ■a place where young children and babies are taken care of while their parents are at work 幼儿园，托儿所
•Does Jake go to a nursery or a childminder?杰克是去托儿所还是由家庭保育员照顾？
 IMPROVER  ■a room in a house where small children sleep and play 育儿室
UK ['nɜ:.sər.i] US ['nɝ:.sɚ-] noun countable FOR PLANTS  为植物  ■a place where plants and trees are grown, especially for sale （尤指商业目的的）苗圃，育苗场
UK ['nɜ:.sər.i] US ['nɝ:.sɚ-] adjective [before noun] ■relating to the teaching of children who are between the ages of two or three to five years old 幼儿教育的
•Do you think the state should provide free nursery education ?你认为国家应该提供免费幼儿教育吗？




n. [林] 苗圃；托儿所；温床
 - soil, nest
examples: 英 ['nɜːsəri] 美 ['nɜːrsəri]
n.托儿所；保育室；苗圃

(1) Many children under five go to nursery school.(2) She's all for more nursery schools being built.(3) She sent her little son to a nursery when she was working.(4) We bought a small tree at the nursery.
(1) 5岁以下的许多儿童都上幼儿园。(2) 她坚持主张多建托儿所。(3) 她工作的时候就把小儿子送到托儿所。(4) 我们在苗圃买了一棵小树。
[sound:youdao-5d2b8009-7a9c7b3e-154d9fdb-d1ac75b9-1dbfe264.mp3]

translation:
n. 螺母，螺帽; 坚果，坚果果仁; 难对付的人; [乐]弓根
v. 采坚果; 拾坚果

时态：nutted, nutting, nuts
分布：螺母(49%)，坚果(28%)，螺帽(16%)，果仁(5%)，采坚果(2%)


→来自拉丁语nux,坚果，果仁，词源同nuclear,nucleus.俚语义睾丸，头，疯子。
n.坚果;螺母,螺帽Shut in the hut, I'm puzzled how to cut down the output of nuts.关在茅棚里,我为削减坚果的产量犯难.



noun FOOD  食物   IMPROVER  countable ■the dry fruit of particular trees which grows in a hard shell and can often be eaten 坚果
•a Brazil/cashew nut巴西坚果／腰果

•Sprinkle some roasted chopped nuts on top.往表面撒些烤过的碎果仁。

[nʌt] noun METAL OBJECT  金属制品  countable ■a small piece of metal with a hole in it which a bolt can be screwed into 螺母，螺帽
•Nuts and bolts are used to hold pieces of machinery together.螺帽和螺栓用来把机器零件装拼在一起。

[nʌt] noun PERSON  人  countable informal ■a person who is mentally ill or who behaves in a very silly or stupid or strange way 疯子；傻瓜；怪人
•What kind of nut would leave a car on a railway track?哪个疯子会把车停在铁轨上？
countable informal ■someone who is extremely enthusiastic about a particular activity or thing 对…入迷的人
•Ian's a tennis nut - he plays every day.伊恩是个网球迷——他每天都打网球。
⇒ See also nuts
[nʌt] noun HEAD  头  countable slang ■a person's head 脑袋
•Come on, use your nut (= think clearly) !好啦，动动你的脑子！

[nʌt] noun MONEY  钱  uncountable US informal ■the amount of money necessary to operate a business or cover your costs 营运经费，开销
•With two houses, three cars and child-support payments, he just couldn't meet his nut, even with a second job.他有两栋房子、三辆要保养的车，还要支付孩子的抚养费。开支这样庞大，尽管他有两份工作也难以为继。

[nʌt] noun be off your nut slang ■to be very silly or stupid 愚蠢万分
•You can't do that! Are you off your nut?你不能那样做！你傻了吗？

[nʌt] noun do your nut UK slang ■to become extremely angry 大发雷霆
•She'll do her nut when she sees the mess.她要是看到这一团糟的话，定会气得火冒三丈的。

[nʌt] noun a hard / tough nut to crack ■a problem that is very difficult to solve or a person who is very difficult to understand 棘手的问题；难以理喻的怪人
[nʌt] noun the nuts and bolts ■the practical facts about a particular thing, rather than theoretical ideas about it 实质性内容
•When it came to the nuts and bolts of running a business, he was clearly unable to cope.当涉及到企业经营的实质性问题时，他显然应付不来。

[nʌt] noun a tough/hard nut ■someone who is very unpleasant and difficult to deal with 讨厌的家伙；难对付的人
•As a teenager, Jack was a real hard nut, always getting into fights.十几岁的杰克很难管教，总是跟人打架。

[nʌt] verb transitive informal ■to hit someone or something with your head 用头撞
•The guy turned round and nutted him.那人转过身来，一头向他撞去。




n. 螺母，螺帽；坚果；难对付的人，难解的问题
 - nutsert, female screw
examples: 英 [nʌt] 美 [nʌt]
n.坚果；果仁n.螺母；螺帽；难对付的人(事)vi.采坚果

(1) He carefully cracked a nut and then give it to me.(2) When we turn the nut, we raise or lower the bob.(3) He soon came up with a nut which had fallen off.(4) She's a tough nut to crack; I don't think she'll give us permission.(5) The kids are nutting in the forest like squirrels.
(1) 他仔细敲开一颗坚果,然后递给了我。(2) 我们一转动螺母，就会升高或降低摆锤。(3) 一会儿他来了，拿着一颗脱落下来的螺帽。(4) 她这个人不好说话，我想她不会答应我们的。(5) 孩子们像小松鼠一样在森林里采集坚果。
[sound:youdao-23bb4b6b-d347783f-4ab93181-b63496f9-dc93e4cb.mp3]

translation:
n. [纺]尼龙; 尼龙织品; 〈口〉尼龙长袜

分布：名词(100%)


→品牌名。
n.尼龙A gallon of gasoline and the nylon overalls fall into the valley.一加仑汽油和尼龙工作裤落进了山谷.



US [-lɑ:n] noun uncountable  ADVANCED  ■an artificial substance used especially to make clothes, ropes and brushes 尼龙
•These covers are 100% nylon.这些套子是百分之百尼龙的。

•a nylon shirt/bag尼龙衬衫／书包
nylons [plural] old-fashioned ■women's nylon tights or stockings (= leg coverings) （女式）尼龙连裤袜，尼龙长袜



n. 尼龙， [纺] 聚酰胺纤维；尼龙袜
 - polymide, polyamide fiber
examples: 英 ['naɪlɒn] 美 ['naɪlɑːn]
n.【U】尼龙（复数）nylons：女长袜.
(1) This coat is made of nylon.(2) She strung the beads with a fine nylon.(3) Cotton is more comfortable to wear than nylon.
(1) 这件衣服是尼龙的。(2) 她用细尼龙线把珠子串了起来。(3) 棉布比尼龙穿着舒服。
